adjectives.description: crinoid (comparative more crinoid, superlative most crinoid)

entries.meaning: Relating to or sharing the qualities and features of the class Crinoidea.
examples: It was treasured and placed in its curious box by the crinoid things of Antarctica, salvaged from their ruins by the serpent-men of Valusia, and peered at aeons later in Lemuria by the first human beings.

entries.meaning: One of the numerous animals that make up the class Crinoidea; the feather stars or sea lilies.
